description.en: The course consists of lectures and seminars that are dealing with Estonia and Estonians. The courses and seminars offer several possibilities to compare Estonia and other countries. During the course, students will discover Estonia and share their personal experiences of Estonia.
description.et: Kursus koosneb loengutest ja seminaridest, mille jooksul arutletakse Eesti maa, looduse, ajaloo, kultuuri, elanike ja traditsioonide üle ning võrreldakse Eestit nende riikidega, kust on pärit kursusel osalevad üliõpilased. Kursuse jooksul avastavad üliõpilased Eestit ja jagavad teistega Eestis kogetut.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce Estonia (state, nature, history, people and culture) to the foreign students of Tartu University. The course participations will discover similarities and differences of Estonia and their homelands and discuss their personal experiences in Estonia.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada välisüliõpilastele Eesti maad, loodust, ajalugu, rahvast ja kultuuri. Kursusel osalejad leiavad Eesti ja oma kodumaa sarnaseid ja erinevaid jooni ning väljendavad oma arvamust Eestis kogetu kohta.

learning_outcomes.en: During the semester the exchange student acquires preliminary knowledge of Estonia, Estonians and Estonian culture, by listening lectures, attending seminars and completing different written and oral tasks.
learning_outcomes.et: Semestri jooksul omandab välisüliõpilane loenguid kuulates, seminaridel osaledes ja ülesandeid täites algteadmised Eestist, eestlastest, Eesti kultuurist.

independent_work.et:
1) Present one Estonian writer, poet, musician, band, composer, artist, film director, actor (a minimum of 500 words text length). Deadlines: inform the teacher about your choice on the 10th of October, please send your short essay on the 22nd of October (Literature), 29th of October (Music), 5th of November (Art), 12th of November (Theatre & Film).
2) Write an essay about her/his subjective key words of Estonia (text: minimum 1000 words. 5 keywords, a minimum of 200 words per one keyword). Deadline: 23rd of November.
3) Create a smart quiz question and 4 variants of answers (at least 1 correct answer included) for the "Quiz of Estonia". Deadline: November 30.
4) Present her/his Estonian map "My Estonia. My Estonian Map". Deadline: 7th of December.
